p: A significant decrease in CK-MB and cTnI activities was observed in the RosA + I/R groups compared to the Vehicle + I/R group (CK-MB: 51.3 ± 10.0 ng/mL vs. 72.1 ± 10.2 ng/mL, Figure 4(A); cTnI: 5 ± 2.0 ng/mL vs. 16.2 ± 3.1 ng/mL, Figure 4(B)). At the same time, a significant decrease in LDH levels was observed in the RosA + OGD/R group compared to the Vehicle + OGD/R group (312.9 ± 26.9 U/L vs. 503.8 ± 51.4 U/L, Figure 4(C)).
